lead_paragraph: RACHLIN--Helen Raebeck, died May 13th, 2016 at the age of 99. Born in Brooklyn, she attended Erasmus Hall High School, Barnard College, and Columbia University Graduate School. She spent her entire career working to improve women's lives. For twenty years, she was the Director of Public Affairs and Training at the National Council of Jewish Women. In 1968, Dorothy Height offered her a position at the National Council of Negro Women, where, in 1970, she established The Women's Center for Education and Career Advancement, an organization which has assisted over 40,000 New York City women. Helen Rachlin was strong, independent and intelligent. She cared deeply for her family and cherished her lifelong friends. She loved nothing more than walking or sitting at the beach, having a martini, and doing the crossword puzzle. She was married to Carl Rachlin, a Labor and Civil Liberties Attorney, for 52 years. She is survived by her daughters, Margaret Pine and Ruth Rachlin Menard, her sons-in-law, Larry Pine and Andrew Menard, three grand-children Jacob Pine, Kate Menard and William Menard, and three great- grand children, Ruby Pine, Sadie Pine, and Kellen Menard. 1/3
